hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification via BTC Spot-ETF Flow Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: A positive CPI surprise (headline < 2.8%) will trigger a 2-hour BTC price surge that is amplified by 40%+ when accompanied by a concurrent reversal from daily net ETF outflows to inflows (>$50M) within the same 2-hour window, compared to the price move following the CPI print alone.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent CPI prints have shown outsized sensitivity in crypto. The catalyst (CPI) provides the initial impulse, but concurrent ETF flow reversal provides the amplification mechanism, confirming institutional re-engagement and adding fuel to the retail/sentiment move. The combination creates a stronger, more sustained short-term momentum.
entry_conditions: US CPI headline print comes in at or below 2.7% (surprise vs. consensus ~2.8%)
BTC 15-min candle closes above its 15-min VWAP within 30 minutes post-print
Real-time ETF flow data (aggregate) shows a reversal from net outflow on prior day to a net inflow of >$50M within the first 90 minutes post-print

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2-hour post-CPI window closes OR price reaches +5% from entry (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price retraces 50% of the initial post-CPI spike (measured from print price to first 30-min high)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A positive CPI surprise with concurrent ETF inflows results in a BTC price move statistically indistinguishable from (or less than) a move following a CPI surprise without the flow reversal, over a 2-hour window.
